constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet)
TPO TPO Name: LBE ORDER NO (201) 1989Date of Order: 13/04/1989 00:00:00Species: CEDAR, Address: 7 FAIRGREENSchedule ID: T001
CILRES CIL ZONE: Higher Rate - RATE: Â£120 per square metre

description: Works to Cedar tree covered by LBE ORDER NO (201) 1989: (T1)  -  Reduce over-extended sub-laterals projecting east by up to 2m, remove large deadwood (>50mm dia.) and storm damaged branches in the crown.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: This consent is valid for two years.Reason: In order that the nature of work pertaining to this consent remains appropriate.

The works hereby permitted shall be carried out in strict accordance with the recommendations set out in the submitted Arboricultural Condition Report Ref.02-202503 dated 18/03/2025. Your attention is drawn to Paragraph 8.2 and Table 4. Your attention is also drawn to the indicative photograph in Appendix 4 which marks the location of the two branches to be reduced in length. The reduction of branches shall be restricted to these two branches only.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved tree.

The works hereby approved shall only be carried out strictly in accordance with British Standard 3998 [2010] 'Tree Works'.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved tree.

Tree work should not be carried out during periods that are likely to interfere with or disturb breeding birds or mammals.Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) and Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2010).
